page.title: 01Llandywydd & Fonthirwaun
page.content: This area is a dairy farming and stock rearing area of West Wales. The landscape is generally rolling hills and valleys with trees both scatterd and concentrated into woodland throughout. The fields averaging about 10 acres, are bounded by hedges growing on top of wide stone walls infilled with earth, giving narrow deepsided lanes and afording protection from the prevailing westerly winds. Most houses are scattered and built from local stone with some modern bungalows dotted here and there. The two vilages are ponthirwaun (50) and Llandygwydd (100). The only industries as such are the cottage type-knitting, restoring furniture an a smokiery with some farms catering for tourists. There are 2 historic mansions.
